0.title: If films worked due to PM Modi's endorsement, Modi biopic would've been biggest hit: Kher
0.article_body: Talking about criticism that his film 'The Kashmir Files' worked because it was endorsed by PM Narendra Modi, actor Anupam Kher said, "If films worked due to PM Modi's endorsement, Narendra Modi biopic would have been the biggest blockbuster." "Not many people tweeted about 'The Kashmir Files', but a lot of people tweeted about the recently released films," he added.

1.title: Govt issues high severity warning for Google Chrome, asks users to update it
1.article_body: The government's CERT-In recently issued a 'high' severity rated warning for Google Chrome for Desktop, warning users about multiple vulnerabilities. The CERT-In said that the vulnerabilities exist in Chrome versions prior to 104.0.5112.101 and urged users to update their browser. Google has also confirmed existence of the security flaws and said they have been fixed in the latest Chrome update.

2.title: Security personnel being killed due to Tripura govt’s negligence: Manik Sarkar
2.article_body: After a BSF head constable was killed in Tripura, ex-CM and Opposition leader Manik Sarkar said the security personnel are being killed in state due to "negligent attitude" of the state government in combating insurgency. "The state government cannot ignore...responsibility of this loss of life," Sarkar added. "The state government should stand with...martyred BSF jawan in all ways," he stated.

3.title: Gujarat CM reshuffles Cabinet, takes charge of Revenue Ministry
3.article_body: Ahead of Assembly elections, the Gujarat government has reshuffled the Cabinet. The Revenue Ministry has been taken away from Rajendra Trivedi while the Road and Building Ministry has been taken away from Purnesh Modi. CM Bhupendra Patel will be holding both Ministries. Harsh Sanghavi, meantime, has been appointed Minister of State (MoS) with responsibility for the Revenue Ministry.

4.title: UP BJP leader beaten up by wife after getting caught with a woman; video surfaces
4.article_body: A BJP leader, identified as Mohit Sonkar, was beaten up by his wife and in-laws after they allegedly saw him in his car with another woman in Uttar Pradesh. In a video of the incident, his wife and mother-in-law could be seen beating him with slippers. ACP Babupurva, Alok Singh, said that an FIR will be registered after proper investigation.

5.title: Ishan needs to know how to make the best use of his chances: RP Singh
5.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said India batter Ishan Kishan needs to make the best use of the chances he's getting at the international level. "It's not that Ishan will not get more chances...but if your performances are not good, you'll slowly-slowly start going out," added Singh. Ishan scored six runs off 13 deliveries in the second ODI against Zimbabwe.

6.title: Amit Shah to address rally in Telangana ahead of Munugode by-polls
6.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah will be addressing a public rally in the Munugode Assembly constituency of Telangana at around 5 pm today. The by-poll is being held after Congress MLA Komatireddy Raj Gopal resigned from his post and joined BJP. Shah is further scheduled to attend another meet at Ramoji Film City after which he will fly back to Delhi.

7.title: People will give Look Out Circular to BJP after 2024 polls: Sisodia
7.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia criticised PM Narendra Modi over the alleged CBI Look Out Circular issued against him and claimed that after the 2024 Lok Sabha polls people will give a Look Out Circular to the BJP. "It’s unfortunate that the PM keeps thinking against whom should a CBI Look Out Circular be issued today," said Sisodia.

8.title: 3 journalists booked in MP over story on elderly man taken to hospital on cart
8.article_body: Three journalists in Madhya Pradesh have been booked over a story on a family taking an elderly man to a hospital on a pushcart due to unavailability of ambulance after a probe found their claim to be false, police said. The journalists identified as Kunjbihari Kaurav, NK Bhatele and Anil Sharma, work as contributors for national and regional news channels.

9.title: Anand Sharma resigns from top Himachal Pradesh Congress post
9.article_body: Congress leader and former Union minister Anand Sharma on Sunday resigned as the Chairman of the party's Steering Committee for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls. In a letter to the party chief Sonia Gandhi, Sharma reportedly said that his self-respect is non-negotiable. However, he has assured that he will participate in campaigns for the Congress candidates.

10.title: 1,000 Congress workers to touch feet of 1 lakh people in Telangana
10.article_body: Ahead of the Munugode bypolls, Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee President Revanth Reddy said that 1,000 party workers will touch feet of 1 lakh people. "Telangana gained independence on September 17. We have scheduled a programme from this very auspicious day to inform the public about the Congress party. The programme is called 'Prajaswamyam ki Padabi Vandanam',” said Reddy.

11.title: Vaishno Devi Yatra resumes after being suspended over bad weather
11.article_body: The pilgrimage to Vaishno Devi Shrine in Jammu and Kashmir's Katra resumed on Sunday morning after being temporarily suspended twice in the previous 24 hours owing to bad weather. "Police and Central Reserve Police Force have already been deployed. The situation is being monitored. No untoward incident has been reported so far," the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board said.

12.title: Woman abuses, hits security guard at Noida society; video goes viral
12.article_body: A video has been widely circulated on social media that showed a woman abusing and assaulting a security guard at a society in Noida. The woman allegedly got into an argument with the guards over a delay in opening the gates. She was also heard telling the guards to "respect women". Meanwhile, the police have registered an FIR against her.

13.title: Italian artist who duct-taped banana to wall & sold it as artwork for $120,000 sued
13.article_body: Italian artist Maurizio Cattelan, who had duct-taped a banana to a wall and sold it as artwork for $120,000 at Art Basel Miami, has been accused by California-based artist Joe Morford of copying his 2000 artwork title 'Banana & Orange'. Cattelan named his artwork 'Comedian'. A Florida court has ruled that Morford can move forward with a case against Cattelan.

14.title: How does 'tomato flu' spread as number of cases in India cross 80?
14.article_body: According to Lancet, children are at an increased risk of exposure to 'tomato flu' which can spread through close contact. Children are also prone to this infection through the use of nappies, touching unclean surfaces and putting things directly into the mouth. Symptoms observed in children with 'tomato flu' include high fever, rashes, body aches and nausea, among others.

15.title: Uni suspends card services after RBI revises digital lending rules
15.article_body: Bengaluru-based credit and payments fintech firm Uni Cards has temporarily suspended active cards after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) strengthened scrutiny over digital lending. The startup is suspending Uni Pay 1/3rd Card and Uni Pay 1/2 Card in a phased process. Uni Card, used for urgent payments, will continue to give customers access to credit line through Uni Cash.

16.title: Make better films, stop being arrogant: Rahul Dholakia on B'wood
16.article_body: Filmmaker Rahul Dholakia took to Twitter and listed five things that need to be done by the film fraternity. He tweeted, "1. Make better films. 2. Reduce [cost of production] 3. Reduce ticket prices drastically 4. Not release films on OTT for three months 5. Stop being Arrogant. Be inclusive. Maybe this will help?" Dholakia directed the 2017 film 'Raees'.

17.title: ₹27 cr looted in name of beautification: Akhilesh after 2 died at Mathura temple
17.article_body: After at least two persons died during Janmashtami celebrations at Bankey Bihari temple in Mathura, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said the incident occurred due to "administrative failure". "The truth is...in the name of beautification…around Shri Bankey Bihari temple of Vrindavan, officials sitting in the Braj Teerth Vikas Parishad...looted ₹27 crore...and devotees didn't get any facilities," he added.

18.title: US-based firm Wayfair's CEO lays off 5% of its global workforce
18.article_body: US-based e-commerce company Wayfair's CEO Niraj Shah has laid off 870 employees after the company's anticipated growth did not materialise. After slashing 5% of its global workforce, the company is looking to make reductions in third party labour costs. The company is expecting layoff costs to range between $30-$40 million, which mainly consists of employee severance.

19.title: Car skids, falls off cliff 500 feet down near Pune; 3 killed, 3 injured
19.article_body: Three people were killed and three others seriously injured after a car they were travelling in  veered off a slippery road and fell off a cliff 500 feet on Pune-Mangaon road on Saturday afternoon. "Primary probe suggests that near Kondethar Sanaswadi village, the driver of the car applied brakes on a slippery patch and could not control it," police said.

20.title: Man sentenced to life plus 375 yrs for killing police officer in US
20.article_body: A man was sentenced to life in prison plus 375 years after he shot and killed a 22-year-old police officer in US' Georgia. The incident occurred when the accused fired an AK-47 at the deceased and other officers who were responding to shots fired in a house and domestic disturbance in 2015. The accused pleaded guilty to the charges.

21.title: Germany's Scholz calls Putin's critic Navalny a 'courageous man'
21.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz praised Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny who was poisoned with Soviet-era nerve agent two years ago. "I...got to know a courageous man who returned to Russia...to fight for democracy," Scholz said. Navalny, an outspoken critic of Russian President Vladimir Putin, is serving a prison sentence over charges of fraud and contempt of court.

22.title: Xi urged US to prevent Pelosi's Taiwan trip, Biden declined: Report
22.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping held a phone conversation with US President Joe Biden last month, asking him to prevent House Speaker Nancy Pelosi from visiting Taiwan, Washington Post reported. The report added that Biden told Xi he "could not oblige" as US Congress is an independent body of the government. Biden reportedly warned Xi against provocative actions during Pelosi's visit.

23.title: Working with US, EU to get Russian food to world markets: UN
23.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said that the UN is working with the US and EU to overcome obstacles to let Russian food and fertilisers reach world markets. He said nations that sanctioned Russia for invading Ukraine made clear that measures did not apply to food and fertilisers. "Getting...food...out of Ukraine and Russia is crucial to calm commodity markets," Guterres added.

24.title: Miss Universe to allow married women, mothers to compete for 1st time in 2023
24.article_body: In a first, the Miss Universe pageant will now allow married women and mothers to participate in the beauty contest in 2023. Until now, it permitted only single women to participate. According to an internal memo, the pageant said, "We...believe that women should have agency over their lives and that...personal decisions should not be a barrier to their success."

25.title: Apple extends repair program for iPhone 12 models with sound issue
25.article_body: Apple has extended its repair program for iPhone 12 models experiencing an earpiece sound issue, now covering them for three years after the first retail sale of the unit. The devices manufactured between October 2020 and April 2021 are eligible for the program. However, iPhone 12 mini and iPhone 12 Pro Max are not covered under it.

26.title: Nearly half of Tigray's population is in severe need of food aid: WFP
26.article_body: Ethiopia's nearly two-year conflict left half of Tigray's population in 'severe' need of food as aid groups struggle to reach due to insufficient fuel supplies, according to the World Food Programme. The report said that half of the pregnant or lactating women are facing malnutrition. The UN agency said even though aid delivery resumed after unilateral ceasefire, malnutrition rate 'skyrocketed'.

27.title: Such things happen, he's coming back after a long time: Kaif on Rahul's 1(5)
27.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has said he is not concerned about KL Rahul's form after the 30-year-old got out after scoring one run off five balls in the second ODI against Zimbabwe. "Such things happen, he's coming back after a long time...It was a pitched-up delivery that came in," stated Kaif. Rahul was playing his first international innings since February.

28.title: At the moment, Axar Patel & Jadeja are on par with each other: Ajay Jadeja
28.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said Axar Patel is at par with Ravindra Jadeja and the only thing that differentiates them is the fielding. "Axar has added to the batting so much more in the last few years," he added. Ajay further said, "Axar is on his (Jadeja's) back, and it's great for Indian cricket."

29.title: After Wipro, TCS delays variable pay for some employees: Report
29.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has reportedly delayed the variable pay for senior employees for the June quarter, days after its rival company Wipro paused variable payouts to mid and senior-level employees. TCS will pay the variable compensation to its employees by August-end now, as per reports. In a statement, TCS said its compensation and bonus cycles are as per plan.

30.title: Ex-BJP Rajasthan MLA who admitted 5 lynchings on camera booked
30.article_body: The Rajasthan Police booked former BJP MLA Gyan Dev Ahuja who was recorded saying that his supporters had "lynched five individuals" for cow smuggling. The case was opened after a video went viral in which Ahuja was asking a group of people to start an agitation against lynching of Chiranjilal Saini, who was allegedly lynched by Mev Muslim community members.

31.title: Pixel owners unable to wirelessly charge after Android 13 update
31.article_body: Some Pixel owners have reported being unable to wirelessly charge after the Android 13 update. Several Reddit posts about the issue were from people using the Pixel 4, 4 XL, 6, and 6 Pro using a variety of wireless chargers. In some cases, the phones do seem to recognise that they are on a wireless charger.

32.title: Indian women still use sieve on Karwa Chauth, unfortunate: Raj minister
32.article_body: Rajasthan minister Govind Ram Meghwal on Saturday said it's unfortunate that even today, women in India see the moon through a sieve on Karwa Chauth and talk about their husband’s long life, while those in China and US are living in the world of science. "A husband never sees a sieve for the long life of his wife," Meghwal added.

33.title: Apple CFO Luca Maestri sells shares worth $16.9 million
33.article_body: Apple CFO Luca Maestri has sold 96,735 shares in the firm for $16.9 million, an SEC filing showed. Maestri carried out two sales of shares on August 17 where one transaction was for 66,390 shares, while the other saw the sale of 30,345 shares. Maestri sold the shares as part of an arranged trading plan adopted by him in 2020.

34.title: Can consider inquiry against ex-PM's portfolios controversy: Aus PM
34.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said his government could consider launching an inquiry into former PM Scott Morrison for secretly taking charge of key ministerial roles during the pandemic. Albanese would seek Solicitor General's advice over the legality of Morrison's actions. Morrison defended himself by saying he felt the nation's responsibility during the pandemic was his alone.

35.title: Jennifer Lopez, Ben Affleck get married for 2nd time; pics go viral
35.article_body: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck on Saturday got married for the second time at Affleck's Georgia home, days after the couple got married in Las Vegas. Actors Matt Damon and Jason Mewes were reportedly among the guests. This comes amid reports that Affleck's mother was hospitalised after she fell off a dock at the venue a day before the wedding.

36.title: Zelenskyy warns of 'vicious' Russian attack ahead of Independence Day
36.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned that Russia might do something "ugly" and "vicious" ahead of celebrations to mark 31 years of independence from Soviet rule. Curfew in Ukraine's second largest city Kharkiv will remain in place for the entire day on Wednesday. Zelenskyy said Ukrainians must not allow Moscow to spread despondency and fear ahead of August 24 events.

37.title: Agencies are being weaponised, Oppn should’ve rallied together: Mufti
37.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti criticised Congress for agitating against another Opposition party. "Sad that Congress is unable to rise above party interests because AAP is a formidable opponent...At a time when agencies are being weaponised, Opposition should’ve rallied together," Mufti tweeted. Her remark came as the Delhi wing of the Congress called for Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's resignation.

38.title: List of 100 loan apps used to extort ₹500 crore released as Delhi Police bust racket
38.article_body: Delhi Police's special unit released a list of over 100 loan apps after busting a ₹500 crore extortion racket and arresting 22 people in connection with the case. It was found that the loan apps uploaded user data to China and Hong Kong-based servers. The listed apps include Loan Cube, Wow Rupee, Smart Wallet, Giant Wallet, Hi Rupee, Swift Rupee.

39.title: Did costume rehearsals, look tests: Alia on Bhansali's 'Balika Vadhu'
39.article_body: Alia Bhatt revealed that she had done costume rehearsals, look tests and even danced on 'Dola Re Dola' for Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Balika Vadhu'. "When he decided to make ['Balika Vadhu']...I was about nine...he said...'I'll wait a couple of years...make it when you are like a little older', but then I think he dropped the idea altogether," she added.

40.title: Russia's Gazprom to shut natural gas pipeline to Europe for 3 days
40.article_body: Russia will halt natural gas supplies to Europe for three days as Nord Stream pipeline will be shut due to maintenance work at a key compressor station, according to state-owned energy company Gazprom. The shutdown will be between August 31 and September 2, it added. In July, Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline was closed for 10 days for maintenance work.

41.title: Shouldn't we release our movies?: Vijay Deverakonda on boycott B'wood trend
41.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda talked about the boycott Bollywood trends on social media. "I don't know exactly what is their (online trolls) issue and what they want," he stated. Vijay revealed they began working on 'Liger' in 2019. He added, "We've worked hard for three years to make this [film]. Shouldn't we release our movies? Should we sit in homes?"

42.title: Karnataka proposes policy to penalise unnecessary use of water
42.article_body: Karnataka, one of the most water-stressed states in India with reportedly about 61% of it in a drought-prone region, has proposed a new water policy to tackle the challenges. The new policy includes measures like penalties for unwise use of water, restricting groundwater extraction and optimising the use of the state's limited water resources, Water Resources Department officials said.

43.title: 3.5 tons of cocaine found in banana shipments in Ecuador, seized
43.article_body: Authorities have seized around 3.5 tons of cocaine which was found in two banana shipments at separate locations in Ecuador, police said on Saturday. One of the shipments, which contained 2,300 cocaine packets, was intercepted by police as it approached the port city of Guayaquil. The other shipment had 1,218 cocaine packets. The containers were bound for UK and Netherlands.

44.title: Mahakal priests urge Zomato to withdraw 'offensive' Hrithik ad, company apologises
44.article_body: Priests from Ujjain's Mahakal temple urged Zomato to withdraw its recent advertisement featuring actor Hrithik Roshan as it offended Hindu sentiments. In the ad, Roshan was seen ordering a 'thali' from 'Mahakal'. Apologising for it, Zomato said that while the ad referred to a thali from Ujjain’s Mahakal Restaurant and doesn't involve Shree Mahakaleshwar Temple, it's now no longer running.

45.title: Mumbai pharmacy worker assaulted over power disruption during Dahi Handi
45.article_body: A 25-year-old pharmacy worker was allegedly dragged out and assaulted by some people over disruption of electricity during a 'Dahi Handi' event in Maharashtra's Nallasopara. One of the accused, Raju Shelar, told the victim that the pharmacy had allowed organisers to take power supply from the shop but it was disrupted. The victim said Shelar pelted a stone at him.

46.title: Gaikwad, Tripathi are waiting, it'd be unfair if they don't get a game: Uthappa
46.article_body: Veteran Indian batter Robin Uthappa has said it would be unfair if Ruturaj Gaikwad and Rahul Tripathi, who are part of the squad for the Zimbabwe series, don't get to play in the third and final ODI. Uthappa further said Deepak Chahar might return for the final ODI. Deepak had registered figures of 3/27 in the first game.

47.title: Over ₹1 cr to be spent on Hyderabad's Khairatabad Ganesh idol
47.article_body: More than ₹1 crore will be spent on preparation of Hyderabad's Khairatabad Ganesh idol, which will reportedly be tallest Ganesh idol in India this year. The committee has decided to install eco-friendly idol made of clay instead of POP. "Artists have come from Chennai to do clay work. 50-100 people are working here on this idol," a devotee said.

48.title: Child dies after brain-eating amoeba enters nose while swimming in river in US
48.article_body: Health officials in the US confirmed that a child died from a rare infection caused by a brain-eating amoeba called naegleria fowleri after swimming in a river in Nebraska. People are usually infected with the amoeba when water containing it enters the body through the nose while swimming in or diving into lakes and rivers, according to US' CDC.

49.title: PharmEasy withdraws plan for ₹6,250 crore IPO citing market conditions
49.article_body: PharmEasy's parent company API Holdings has announced that it has withdrawn the draft papers submitted for an IPO, due to "market conditions and strategic considerations". The company had filed the draft papers with the SEBI last year to raise ₹6,250 crore through fresh equity issuance. The online pharmacy startup is now planning to raise funds through a rights issue.

50.title: When I entered the industry, I didn't know anybody: Adah Sharma
50.article_body: Actress Adah Sharma opened up about her struggles in Bollywood and said she didn't know anyone when she had entered the film industry. "I was like I could act...dance. Of course, I'll get movies. But then you realise, there were no rules," she added. "You realise...if you're not from the industry for opportunities to come, it gets tough," she stated.

51.title: Xiaomi fires over 900 employees amid revenue drop: Report
51.article_body: Xiaomi has reportedly fired over 900 employees as its revenue dropped nearly 20% in the June quarter. A report said that the layoffs account for nearly 3% of Xiaomi’s workforce. Hit by COVID-19 restrictions, the company’s sales fell 20% year-on-year to 70.17 billion yuan, marking a decline from its previous quarter when it posted its first revenue drop since listing.

52.title: Mahindra shares viral post on Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's advice, calls it 'worth billions'
52.article_body: Anand Mahindra has shared a viral post on late billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's old interview, wherein he said his worst investment had been his health and urged others to "invest the most in that". "Rakesh gave the most valuable and profitable investment advice ever. It's advice that is worth billions...it requires investing your time, not your money," Mahindra said.

53.title: BJP will do better in 2024 if Kejriwal becomes Opposition's PM face: Assam CM
53.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that BJP would win by a better margin if AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal is projected as Opposition's PM candidate in the next general election. "People in many states do not know Kejriwal and his party. It would be very good for BJP...as most people haven't even heard his name," Sarma added.

54.title: Tsitsipas beats world no.1  Medvedev to enter final at Cincinnati Open
54.article_body: World number seven Stefanos Tsitsipas defeated world number one Daniil Medvedev to reach the final for the first time at the Cincinnati Open. Tsitsipas won with a scoreline of 7-6(8-6), 3-6, 6-3 in the semi-final. He will face Croatian Borna Coric in the summit clash. Notably, it was only the third time that Tsitsipas defeated Medvedev in their 10-match history.

55.title: Twitter employees may get only half of their annual bonus, warns company
55.article_body: Twitter has warned employees they may only receive half of their annual bonuses, the company confirmed to The New York Times. In an email to staff, CFO Ned Segal said Twitter's financial challenges will affect the annual bonuses they receive. Twitter's bonus pool is currently at 50% of what it could be if Twitter met its financial targets, he added.

56.title: People said 'You're such a b**ch': Barkha on reaction to her 'Masaba...' role
56.article_body: Actress Barkha Singh, speaking about people's reaction to her performance in 'Masaba Masaba 2', has said, "Almost everyone close to me had a similar reaction, 'Wow Barkha, you're such a b**ch'." Barkha revealed her introduction scene in the series was also her audition scene. "I'd give credit to Masaba Gupta, she made sure that I was feeling easy," she added.

57.title: Every morning Centre wakes up, starts CBI-ED game: Arvind Kejriwal
57.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal tweeted on Sunday that every morning the central government "wakes up and starts this CBI-ED game". This comes as CBI issued a Look Out Notice against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and others. The central government should work with state governments to fight unemployment and inflation, instead, "they are fighting with the whole country," he added.

58.title: Build democracy where differences in identities & opinions are respected: CJI
58.article_body: CJI NV Ramana urged the people to build a democracy filled with vibrancy and idealism, where differences in identities and opinions are respected. "Don’t allow corrupt thoughts. Don’t tolerate injustices. Be sensitive to the needs of the community and society," CJI Ramana said on Saturday. The CJI further said that the people should have faith in the judiciary.

59.title: Chemical tanker crashes into cargo ship off the coast of Japan
59.article_body: A chemical tanker crashed into a cargo ship off the coast of southwestern Japan on Saturday, the coast guard said. None of the 20 crew members on board the two vessels were injured in the incident. The cargo ship had initially begun to sink after some oil leaked from its engine but it was brought under control, an official said.

60.title: UP minister returns without attending event as college doesn't open gate
60.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Higher Education Minister Yogendra Upadhyaya returned from the entrance of a college in Agra without attending an exhibition as the college gate wasn’t opened for him. The minister reportedly waited for 15 minutes and returned "seemingly irritated". Meanwhile, the college administration has ordered a probe into the incident and sought an explanation from the organisers.

61.title: Alia Bhatt reveals she was paid ₹15 lakh for her debut film 'Student Of The Year'
61.article_body: In an interview, actress Alia Bhatt revealed she was paid ₹15 lakh for her debut film 'Student Of The Year'. "I...deposited the cheque to my mother and very nicely I said, 'Mumma you handle the money.' And till date, my mother handles my money," she said. Alia added she doesn't know how much money she has in her bank account.

62.title: WhatsApp may allow users to recover messages deleted by mistake: Report
62.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a feature to allow users to recover messages deleted by mistake when they tap 'delete for me' instead of 'delete for everyone', WABetaInfo reported. The feature will allow users to restore a deleted message by clicking undo on a bar that will be shown to them for a few seconds after they have deleted a message.

63.title: People are not accepting B'wood due to its hypocrisy, arrogance: Vivek
63.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri, in a statement, has said that the people have seen through the "hypocrisy" and "arrogance" of Bollywood and now people are unwilling to accept it. "Go to any middle-class, urban, semi-urban household and interview them and you will find how people hate the arrogance, glossy lifestyle and the disconnect of Bollywood with real-life audiences," he added.

64.title: BJP is saying it will bring Eknath Shinde in T'gana, topple our govt: KCR
64.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday claimed that BJP is saying it would bring down his government in Telangana. "The BJP is saying that they will bring Eknath Shinde here and topple our government. Who will do this? You are saying this because of your arrogance," CM Rao added. "No section benefitted under PM Modi's rule," Rao stated.

65.title: Mumbai local train services to be hit as Railways to carry out mega block
65.article_body: Mumbai local train services will be hit on Sunday as Central Railway and Western Railway zone will carry out mega block on its suburban sections for maintenance works. Harbour line passengers have been permitted to travel via Main line and Western Railway from 10 am to 6 pm and special locals will run on Panvel-Kurla section during the block period.

66.title: Want permanent peace with India, war not an option: Pakistan PM
66.article_body: Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has said that Pakistan wants to have "permanent peace" with India through dialogue as war is not an option for either of the countries to resolve the Kashmir issue. Sharif also said that sustainable peace in the region was linked to the resolution of the Kashmir issue as per UN resolutions.

67.title: Noida Police issues traffic advisory after Tyagi community calls 'mahapanchayat'
67.article_body: Noida Traffic Police issued a traffic diversion plan for commuters after Tyagi community called for 'mahapanchayat' today in support of Shrikant Tyagi, a self-proclaimed politician who was recently arrested. The 'mahapanchayat' will take place at Maharishi Ashram Ramlila Maidan. As per the organisers, lakhs of members of the Tyagi community from across western UP will attend the rally.

68.title: Tell me where to come: Sisodia after CBI issues Look Out Notice against him
68.article_body: After CBI issued Look Out Notice against Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia and others in Delhi Excise Policy Scam, Sisodia took to Twitter to say, "All your raids have failed...now you have issued a Look Out Notice...What is this gimmick, Modi ji?" "I'm roaming freely in Delhi, tell me where to come? You can't find me?" his tweet read.

69.title: By the time you get back from pee break, England are all out: Boycott
69.article_body: Ex-England batsman Geoffrey Boycott said it was "madness" for England batters to try and attack South Africa pacers when they were bowling with the new ball in the first Test. "When you watch England face pacers...you don't want to get up...go for a pee because if you do, by the time you get back, they'll be all out," added Boycott.

70.title: 23-year-old Haryana man dies by suicide over alleged delay in visa for Canada
70.article_body: A 23-year-old man in Haryana died by suicide over an alleged delay in his student visa for Canada. After being missing for two days, his body was recovered from a canal in Kurukshetra. While his visa arrived a day after he went missing, as per an acquaintance, he had been upset ever since his friend's visa to Canada came.

71.title: Delhi people to get missed call, WhatsApp options to register choice for power subsidy
71.article_body: The Delhi government will release a phone number with missed call and WhatsApp options for city residents to choose if they want to continue availing free electricity scheme from October 1. "Delhiites will also have...convenience of opting in through a QR (Quick Response) code on the bill or by visiting the discom centre," Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said.

72.title: Ford unveils concept car with digital floor, glass roof & chess piece controller
72.article_body: Ford Motor has unveiled a futuristic concept car modelled after its Lincoln brand's first luxury vehicle. The Lincoln Model L100 has a glass roof, reverse-hinged doors and a 'digital floor' featuring a large screen that can be personalised. The autonomous vehicle also replaces the traditional steering wheel with a jewel-inspired chess piece controller and allows changes in seating configurations.

73.title: Delhi Excise Policy best of its kind: Deputy CM Manish Sisodia
73.article_body: The Delhi Excise Policy 2021-22 was the "best" of its kind and would have earned ₹10,000 crore every year had the ex-LG not been "asked" to change his decision at the last minute, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said on Saturday. His statement comes after CBI conducted a raid at his residence in connection with the excise policy case.

74.title: Wish to work with Nawazuddin Siddiqui, he's wonderful: 'KGF' actor Yash
74.article_body: Actor Yash, who featured in the 'KGF' franchise, was asked which Bollywood actor would he work with. To this, he replied, "I wish to work with Nawazuddin Siddiqui. I feel he is a wonderful actor." Nawazuddin is known for movies like 'Gangs Of Wasseypur' franchise, 'Manto', 'Mom'. Nawazuddin will feature in 'Tiku Weds Sheru'.

75.title: SpaceX Dragon spacecraft returns from ISS with 4,000 pounds of cargo
75.article_body: An uncrewed SpaceX Dragon cargo spacecraft has returned from the International Space Station with over 4,000 pounds of valuable scientific experiments and other cargo. With this, SpaceX completed its 25th cargo resupply mission to the space station. SpaceX launched the mission in July and delivered 5,800 pounds of science experiments, crew supplies and other critical cargo.

76.title: UP lawyer booked for stalking woman judge, peeping into her office
76.article_body: A woman judge posted in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur lodged an FIR against a lawyer for allegedly harassing and stalking her, the police said. The lawyer allegedly followed the judge on walks wearing matching clothes and passed lewd remarks. The judge further told police that lawyer Mohammad Haroon peeped into her office through a hole in the wall and messaged her.

77.title: Look Out Circular issued against Sisodia, others in Delhi Excise Policy Scam: Report
77.article_body: Days after CBI conducted raids at several locations in connection with Delhi's Excise Policy scam, probe agency has now issued Look Out Circular (LOC) against all accused named in the scam, reports said. A Look Out Circular has also been issued against Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia. Those named in scam have been restricted from travelling abroad, officials said.

78.title: Daughter of Russian Prez's ally called 'Putin's brain' killed in car blast: Report
78.article_body: Daria Dugina, the 29-year-old daughter of Russian President Vladimir Putin's close aide and philosopher Alexander Dugin, has died in a car explosion in Moscow, according to state media. It is not clear if Alexander Dugin, who's known as 'Putin's brain', was the intended target. Unverified videos of the scene shows a car on fire with Alexander Dugin watching in shock.

79.title: Debina & I are in happy space: Gurmeet on being trolled over 2nd pregnancy
79.article_body: Actor Gurmeet Choudhary has reacted to him and his wife Debina Bonnerjee being trolled after announcing second pregnancy four months after having their first child. "I don't pay heed to trolls as they are everywhere...they criticise everyone...Debina and I are in a very happy space. Only we know our truths," he stated. Gurmeet added he never reads the comments.

80.title: It didn't work out: Rahul on his 1st international innings since February
80.article_body: Team India stand-in captain KL Rahul, who got dismissed after scoring one run off five balls in the second ODI against Zimbabwe, said he needed "some time in the middle" in the game but "unfortunately, it didn't happen". Rahul was playing his first international innings since his 49-run outing against the West Indies in an ODI in February.

81.title: 2 Russians, 1 Ukrainian try to enter Albanian military plant, held
81.article_body: Two Russian nationals and one Ukrainian national were arrested after they tried to enter a military plant in central Albania, the country's Defence Ministry said on Saturday. "The officers who were guarding the plant reacted immediately, but during their efforts...two of our soldiers were injured," it added. Albanian PM Edi Rama said that the trio are "suspected of espionage".

82.title: Justice done can quickly be undone if people don't have right discourse: SC judge
82.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice DY Chandrachud said that justice done can quickly be undone if people do not continue with the right discourse to safeguard the interests of marginalised groups. "I am merely questioning the discourse that class actions (lawsuits) in courts are the only way to meaningfully claim the rights in public spaces?" Justice Chandrachud added.

83.title: Fraudster uses BEST GM's profile pic, texts employees to extort money
83.article_body: Several Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) employees received a 'friendly text' on WhatsApp from a number which claimed to be their General Manager Lokesh Chandra and tried to extort money. The WhatsApp number would have Chandra's profile picture and the modus-operandi would be an excuse that he is about to step into an important meeting and urgently require money.

84.title: Pak media watchdog bans live broadcast of Imran Khan's speeches
84.article_body: The Pakistan Electronic Media Regulatory Authority (PERMA) on Saturday banned the live broadcast of former PM Imran Khan's speeches after he threatened police and a female magistrate in a speech. The media watchdog said that Khan's recorded speeches will be aired only after an effective delay mechanism is put in place to ensure effective monitoring and editorial control.

85.title: 20-yr-old man makes minor girls beg at Pune signal, takes their money; booked
85.article_body: A 20-year-old man has been booked for making two minor girls beg at a traffic signal in Pune. A team of the Social Security Cell saw the accused with the girls at the traffic signal, police said, adding that he was making the girls beg and was taking money himself. The girls were rescued and sent to a children's home.

86.title: IAS officer lists how to use newspapers for preparation of civil services exam
86.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan listed things people could read in newspapers to prepare for civil services exam. "Read one Hindi/English national newspaper. Focus on editorial page. Read for maximum 1-2 hours. Don't make a habit of making notes from newspaper. Read Yojana, Kurukshetra, Frontline with any one monthly magazine (Chronicle/Darpan)," the officer tweeted in Hindi.

87.title: It is cheating: Wipro Chairman on employees moonlighting in tech industry
87.article_body: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji took to Twitter to criticise the practice of 'moonlighting' by employees in the tech industry. "There is a lot of chatter about people moonlighting...This is cheating - plain and simple," Premji tweeted. Moonlighting refers to the practice of employees working on a second job, in addition to one's regular employment.

88.title: Didn't force teacher to resign: St Xavier's VC amid controversy over her Insta pics
88.article_body: St Xavier's University Vice-Chancellor Father Felix Raj said the college didn't force any teacher to resign over her Instagram posts. He added, "She was on probation. She served us...for two months…There's no question of force. There were some unpleasant developments, of course." The teacher had alleged that she was forced to resign over her private bikini pictures posted on Instagram.

89.title: 22 die in Himachal Pradesh amid rains, landslides; IMD issues orange alert
89.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for Himachal Pradesh after 22 people were killed in the state due to heavy rainfall and landslides since Friday. An official said that maximum damage has been reported from Mandi, Kangra and Chamba districts and that 36 weather related incidents have been reported from the state so far.

90.title: Mumbai Police detains barber after receiving '26/11-style' terror threat
90.article_body: The Mumbai Police detained a barber from Virar for questioning after several WhatsApp messages were received on Mumbai's Traffic Control Room number, warning of a '26/11 like' terror strike. The barber hails from UP and had recently shifted to Virar, the police said. The number from which threats were issued, had a Pakistan series sim card, the police added.

91.title: Bowled in right areas, didn't think about wickets: Siraj on his 1/16 in 2nd ODI
91.article_body: Revealing his plan after India's five-wicket win against Zimbabwe in second ODI, India pacer Mohammed Siraj said his plan was to hit an area consistently without worrying whether he'll get wickets or not. "Just wanted to keep hitting the right areas and bowl dot balls to build up pressure on the opposition," he added. Siraj posted bowling figures of 8-2-16-1.

92.title: Bus hits emergency teams in south Turkey, 15 killed
92.article_body: At least 15 people were killed and nearly two dozen were hurt after a passenger bus hit emergency personnel working at the site of an earlier road accident in southern Turkey on Saturday. Two journalists, two paramedics and three firefighters were among the deceased. The remaining deaths were of the occupants of the bus, Turkish Interior Minister Suleyman Soylu said.

93.title: ATS arrests man from Shirdi in Amritsar IED case
93.article_body: The Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad has arrested a man from Shirdi in connection with the case of placing a bomb under the vehicle of Punjab Police sub-inspector Dilbagh Singh in Amritsar. The joint operation between the Squad and the Punjab Police led to his arrest. Earlier this week, Punjab Police arrested two people from Delhi.

94.title: Delhi police bust extortion racket worth ₹500 crores, 22 arrested
94.article_body: Delhi Police have bust an instant loan-cum-extortion racket amounting to over ₹500 crores and arrested 22 people from across the country in connection to it, officials said on Saturday. Chinese nationals are the masterminds of this racket, they said. The extorted money would be routed out of the country through hawala and cryptocurrencies.

95.title: US scholar Chomsky, others urge SC to free Teesta in Gujarat riots case
95.article_body: Top international scholars, including American linguist Noam Chomsky, have urged Indian Supreme Court to free activist-journalist Teesta Setalvad and ex-DGP RB Sreekumar in the 2002 Gujarat riots case. The SC "unfairly" attributed ulterior motives to the two while dismissing their plea, their statement read. "We're dismayed by the recent tendency discernible in the...[court's] judgment," it added.

96.title: To win more Slams, break longest world no. 1 record: Djokovic on his goals
96.article_body: Stating his "clear goals", 21-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic said he believes that he can win more Grand Slams and can break the longest world number one record. With total 373 weeks, Djokovic holds the record for spending the most number of weeks atop the ATP rankings. Steffi Graf held the top spot for 377 weeks, an all-time record.

97.title: Mother fell unconscious during bombing: Djokovic on 1999 Serbia war
97.article_body: Novak Djokovic said his family getting caught in the 1999 war in Serbia is one of his "most traumatic experiences". Novak said the sudden bombings around their then house led to his mom hitting her head and falling unconscious. The tennis star's father took charge, got Novak's mother up and the family grabbed what they could to escape the area.

98.title: Gujarat records 258 new COVID-19 cases, 3 deaths
98.article_body: Gujarat added 258 fresh cases to its COVID-19 tally on Saturday, a state health department official informed. The state also recorded three deaths due to the infection, the official added. As many as 637 recoveries were also recorded. Gujarat's active caseload declined to 2,553 on Saturday from 2,935 on Friday.

99.title: No quick solution to extremely heavy F1 cars: Max Verstappen
99.article_body: F1 championship leader Max Verstappen says there is no quick solution to reducing the weight of the cars, which is currently the heaviest in the sport's history. "They're extremely heavy, which I think is not great...overall, the following and stuff has been a bit better," said the Red Bull racer. F1 drivers have complained that the heavy cars are sluggish.

100.title: 18-yr-old Bihar girl consumes poison as boyfriend refuses to marry her
100.article_body: An 18-year-old girl consumed poison on Thursday in Bihar's Bhojpur district after her boyfriend mocked her and refused to marry her following a consensual physical relationship, local media reported. The girl's mother said that she was in a relationship with a young man for two years. The victim, identified as Priyanka Kumari, is currently in a hospital.

101.title: Man survives after 12-foot alligator bites his head in US, incident caught on camera
101.article_body: A Florida man survived an alligator attack after the 12-foot reptile bit his head. Juan Carlos LaVerde was swimming in Lake Thonotosassa, Florida on August 3 when the incident took place. Aerial footage shows the alligator headed straight for the ex-member of the US Air Force Pararescue, who was working on an instructional video at the time of the attack.

102.title: Waqar Younis says 'Shaheen's injury a big relief for Indian top-order batters', gets trolled
102.article_body: Reacting to Pakistani pacer Shaheen Afridi getting ruled out of Asia Cup, ex-Pakistan captain Waqar Younis tweeted, "Shaheen’s injury [is a] big relief for the Indian top-order [batters]." Younis was trolled by Indian fans for his remark. "If one player's absence makes a team clueless...then that team's...a joke," wrote a fan. "Will you decide by just one match?" another wrote.

103.title: Just fantastic: Graeme Smith on India playing Tests under Kohli
103.article_body: Former South Africa captain Graeme Smith said "it was just fantastic" to see India take Test cricket seriously under Virat Kohli's captaincy. "India led [the] way in Test cricket under Kohli. It was just fantastic," said Smith. Considering the level of competitiveness, he added that only five or six nations might be able to play Test cricket currently.

104.title: Former UK minister endorses Rishi Sunak's candidacy in PM race
104.article_body: Senior Conservative Party MP Michael Gove on Saturday endorsed Rishi Sunak's candidacy for the post of the UK's Prime Minister. Gove branded the tax reduction plans of Liz Truss, who is Sunak's opponent in the PM race, as a “holiday from reality”. “I know what the job requires. And Rishi has it,” Gove wrote in ‘The Times’ newspaper.

105.title: I am telling you no bowlers want to bowl to Kohli when he crosses 15-20 runs: Chahal
105.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said, "If he's there at the crease and has 15-20 runs behind him...I'm telling you no bowler wants to bowl to him." He added, "You just see his average across...formats...problem is we just think about his hundreds, we don't talk about those valuable contributions of 60-70 because of the standards he has set."

106.title: Karnataka logs 1,713 fresh COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths
106.article_body: Karnataka logged 1,713 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 5.33% on Saturday, the state health department said. Four deaths due to the infection were also reported. Two deaths were reported from Dharwad district while one fatality each was recorded in Bengaluru Rural and Mysuru. Karnataka's active case tally stood at 10,452, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin.

107.title: Chhattisgarh govt to set up English medium colleges in every district
107.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government has decided to set up English medium colleges in every state district over the next three years. The institutes will be named as Swami Atmanand English Medium Model Colleges, CM Bhupesh Baghel said. Notably, the move is aimed at encouraging native students to pursue higher studies in the state and reduce parents' financial burden, an official said.

108.title: Plan made in UAE to smuggle 500-kg drugs from Pak: NIA on Guj drug case
108.article_body: National Investigation Agency's fresh chargesheet in the Salaya drug seizure case revealed that the conspiracy to smuggle 500-kg heroin from Pakistan to Gujarat in 2018 was hatched in Dubai, UAE. It said the heroin, costing ₹1,500 crore in the international market, was to be further delivered to Punjab for raising funds by a Pakistani national and to harm Indian youths.

109.title: 13 injured in bus-oil tanker collision in Himachal's Kangra
109.article_body: A collision between a private bus and an oil tanker in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra district on Saturday left 13 passengers injured, officials said. According to officials, the accident took place at Sadwan in Nurpur sub-division. The injured were rushed to Civil Hospital Nurpur, officials added. One of the injured has been referred to Tanda hospital, a Civil Hospital official said.

110.title: Ayan worked for 7 yrs on Brahmastra, hope it reaps rich dividends: Karan
110.article_body: Karan Johar, producer of the upcoming film 'Brahmastra' starring Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt, has said director Ayan Mukerji "worked tirelessly" for seven years on this project. "I hope that reaps rich dividends because everyone has put their blood, sweat and tears into every frame of the magnitude of Brahmastra," he added. 'Brahmastra' is set to release on September 9.

111.title: Would be tempted to give Dhawan a go in India's T20 WC squad: Reetinder
111.article_body: Reetinder Singh Sodhi said India opener Shikhar Dhawan doesn't seem to be in the scheme of things in T20Is, but his consistency over the past couple of months has been incredible. "If I'm a selector, I'd be tempted to give him a go in India's T20 World Cup squad," he added. Dhawan last played in a T20I in July 2021.

112.title: 31 killed as heavy rains lash Himachal, Uttarakhand & Odisha
112.article_body: Flash floods, landslides and house collapses triggered by incessant rains claimed at least 31 lives across the country on Friday and Saturday. The most fatalities were from Himachal Pradesh where 22 people were killed, followed by Uttarakhand (4), Odisha (4) and Jharkhand (1). As many as 743 roads were out of bounds for traffic in Himachal Pradesh.

113.title: Alia Bhatt to add Kapoor to her name, says 'I don't want to feel left out'
113.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, who got married to actor Ranbir Kapoor in April, said in an interview that she will add Kapoor to her name. "I don't want to be the Bhatt while the Kapoors are travelling together. I don't want to feel left out," she added. However, the actress cleared that her screen name will remain Alia Bhatt.

114.title: Spurs' Harry Kane sets PL record for scoring most goals for a club
114.article_body: Tottenham Hotspur striker Harry Kane set a Premier League record as the highest goalscorer (185) for a club during the 1-0 victory against Wolverhampton Wanderers on Saturday. The goal was also Spurs' 1,000th Premier League goal at home and Kane's 250th goal for the club across all competitions. The win takes Spurs to the top of the table.

115.title: Makes no sense that there is no first-class cricket during Test series: Cook
115.article_body: After England lost to South Africa in the first Test at Lord's on Friday, former English skipper Alastair Cook pointed out the lack of first-class games during the Test series. "It makes zero sense that there is no first-class cricket going on [in England] for anyone to play when there's a Test match series going on," Cook said.

116.title: Huge megalithic complex of 500 standing stones found in Spain
116.article_body: Researchers have discovered a huge megalithic complex with over 500 standing stones in southern Spain. They were found on a plot of land spanning 1,500 acres that had been earmarked for an avocado plantation in Huelva near the Guadiana River. "This is the biggest and most diverse collection of standing stones grouped together in the Iberian peninsula," a researcher said.

117.title: Anil won't like being called nana, jokes Karan after birth of Sonam's son
117.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar during an Instagram live session on Saturday congratulated actress Sonam Kapoor and her husband Anand Ahuja on the birth of their son. "I can't believe Sonam is a mother now. I don't think Anil (Kapoor) will like being called nana (grandfather) because he's jawaan as hell," Karan said. Sonam and Anand welcomed the baby boy on Saturday.

118.title: Higher institutes losing relevance due to education factories: CJI
118.article_body: CJI NV Ramana said higher learning institutions were losing their social relevance because of the "mushrooming of factories of education". He added that students entered universities with the sole purpose of getting a "highly remunerative and profitable job". Stating he didn't know who to blame for this, CJI Ramana said institutes should "create individuals as meaningful members of society".

119.title: 'Let's fight', tweets Deverakonda as 'Boycott Liger' trends on Twitter
119.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda, who'll be seen in 'Liger', on Saturday tweeted, "When we're correct, when we do our dharma, we don't have to listen to anyone. Let's fight." This comes after '#boycottLiger' started trending on Twitter. Vijay recently spoke on cancel culture and the trend of boycotting Laal Singh Chaddha, saying, "When you...boycott, you're not only affecting Aamir, you're affecting thousands."

120.title: Shaheen tells fan 'Yaar, bas kya karein' after being ruled out of Asia Cup 2022, video viral
120.article_body: Pakistani fast bowler Shaheen Afridi was seen interacting with fans after getting ruled out of Asia Cup 2022. In a video that has gone viral, he was heard telling a fan, "Yaar, bas kya karein?" The fan was then heard saying, "I am feeling very sad." Pakistan are currently touring Netherlands for a three-ODI series.

121.title: India has 75,000 startups, is world's largest startup ecosystem: Nadda
121.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Saturday said that India has over 75,000 startups now, making it the world's largest startup ecosystem. "More than 100 (startups) have become unicorns," he said. Speaking at Himachal Pradesh's Nahan, Nadda said that due to COVID-19 pandemic, the global economy slowed down, but even then, India continued to develop at a rapid rate.

122.title: Scotland museum to return 7 ancient artefacts to India
122.article_body: Museums in Scottish city Glasgow have inked an agreement with Indian government to repatriate seven stolen artefacts to India. The antiquities include a 14th Century Indo-Persian sword and an 11th Century carved stone door jamb. Acting Indian High Commissioner to UK Sujit Ghosh said, "These artefacts are...integral part of our civilisational heritage and will now be sent back home."

123.title: We put up a good fight: Chakabva on Zimbabwe's 5-wicket loss in 2nd ODI
123.article_body: After Zimbabwe's five-wicket loss against India in second ODI, Zimbabwe captain Regis Chakabva said his side put up a good fight in Harare. "Last few games we struggled to pick up early wickets...Today we were short of a few runs. We were up for the challenge," he added. India have taken an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series.

124.title: Zimbabwe bowlers came strong at us, posed challenge: KL Rahul
124.article_body: After winning the second ODI on Saturday against Zimbabwe by five wickets, Indian skipper KL Rahul said that the Zimbabwean bowlers came "strong" at them, which was a "good challenge" for Indian batters. "They (Zimbabwe) do have some quality bowlers, I saw that in the previous series against Bangladesh...We are here to play good cricket and win," Rahul said.

125.title: 82 cases of ‘Tomato Fever’ recorded in India: Lancet
125.article_body: India has recorded 82 cases of the 'Tomato Fever' infection known to affect children under the age of five, said The Lancet. First detected in Kerala on May 6, the flu is a rare viral disease that causes red-coloured rashes, skin irritation and dehydration. Treatment requires a doctor's consultation with one of the precautions being to not scratch the blisters.

126.title: NGT orders closure of Murthal eateries violating environmental norms
126.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has directed the Haryana government to shut roadside eateries and restaurants that are violating environmental norms in Murthal. A bench headed by NGT Chairperson Justice AK Goel also noted that no effective action has been taken on the ground level  by the authorities and there is unchecked continuing damage to the environment.

127.title: CBI court rejects Mondal's bail plea, extends custody till Aug 24
127.article_body: A special CBI court in West Bengal rejected Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Anubrata Mondal's bail plea on Saturday in the alleged cattle smuggling scam case. The court extended his custody till August 24. The CBI had appealed for an extension of his custody by stating that Mondal, "a highly influential person", could "influence witnesses and tamper evidence if granted bail".

128.title: 12 IAS officers shifted in Delhi hours after raid at Dy CM's home
128.article_body: Twelve IAS officers of the Delhi government have been transferred within its departments. Special Secretary Health and Family Welfare Udit Prakash Rai, who earlier faced corruption charges, has been transferred to Administrative Reforms Department. The bureaucratic rejig comes hours after Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's residence was raided by the CBI.

129.title: Apple supplier Foxconn to invest $300 mn more in Vietnam, to create 30,000 jobs: Reports
129.article_body: Apple supplier Foxconn has signed a $300 million memorandum of understanding with Vietnamese developer Kinh Bac City to expand its facility in the north of the country to diversify and boost production, reports said. The Taiwanese company's new factory, on a plot of 50.5 hectares in Bac Giang province, will generate 30,000 local jobs, reports added.

130.title: Congress shares purported clip of BJP leader admitting to lynching
130.article_body: Rajasthan Congress President Govind Singh Dotasra on Saturday shared a video on Twitter in which former BJP MLA Gyan Dev Ahuja purportedly admits that his supporters have "lynched five people". In the alleged video, Ahuja said, "We have so far lynched five people, be it in Lawandi or Behror." Dotasra said the video exposes "the real face of the BJP".

131.title: Elon Musk approaches brain chip implant developer Synchron about deal: Reports
131.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has reportedly approached brain chip implant developer Synchron about a potential deal. This comes as Synchron is ahead of Musk-owned Neuralink in the process to win regulatory clearance for its devices, reports said. Synchron has not decided whether it would accept an investment and no deal is certain, reports added.

132.title: Delhi Police arrest garment seller on terror funding charge
132.article_body: A 48-year-old garment trader based in Delhi's Meena Bazaar has been arrested for alleged involvement in a terror funding operation. Police said Mohammad Yaseen allegedly funded banned groups Lashkar-e-Taiba and al-Badr via hawala transactions. The funds for terror were sent from South Africa to Surat and Mumbai and Yaseen was the link in Delhi, officials said.

133.title: Hooda creates world record for most consecutive wins in international cricket since debut
133.article_body: Team India batter Deepak Hooda on Saturday created world record for most consecutive matches won by a player since debut in international cricket. India have won all their 16 matches in which Hooda has played so far. The previous world record was held by Romania's Satvik Nadigotla (15 consecutive wins since debut).

134.title: Even base price of an IPL player is more: Ashwin on Zimbabwe T20 league's prize money
134.article_body: Talking about pay disparity, Team India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin stated that Zimbabwe T20 league's total prize money of $10,000 (over ₹8 lakh) is even less than what a base price of an IPL player is. Referring to an article, Ashwin said, "Wherever there is more money, employment opportunities are better, and there are better chances of players flourishing."

135.title: Enjoying wicketkeeping, batting: Samson on his 43* and 3 catches in 2nd ODI
135.article_body: Following India's five-wicket win against Zimbabwe in the second ODI, Indian wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson said he is enjoying wicketkeeping and batting. "I think they (Indian bowlers) were bowling [in] really good areas, a lot of balls came nicely to me," he added. Samson, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match', scored 43*(39) and took three catches on Saturday.

136.title: PM Modi should work with states to strengthen economy: Rajasthan CM
136.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Saturday said PM Narendra Modi should take states into confidence and work with them to strengthen the economy. Speaking after inaugurating Rajiv Gandhi Centre of Advance Technology in Jaipur, Gehlot said, "We should be worried about the situation the country is moving towards." "I am seeing such an atmosphere for the first time," he added.

137.title: Greece's 12-year-long EU fiscal oversight ends
137.article_body: Greece's 12-year-long fiscal surveillance by the European Union ended on Saturday with Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis calling it a "historic day". European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said "the country can close this chapter, and look to the future with confidence". The fiscal surveillance was imposed in exchange for bailout packages after the country faced a debt crisis.

138.title: 2 more ships leave Ukraine under Black Sea grain export deal
138.article_body: Two more ships carrying agricultural products departed from Ukraine's Chornomorsk port under the Black Sea grain export deal signed last month, Turkey said on Saturday. This takes the number of ships to leave Ukraine under the pact to 27. Ukraine's Sea Ports Authority on Saturday said that three seaports had begun loading 66,500 tonnes of agricultural products onto seven ships.

139.title: PM Modi's govt has surrendered to China's threats: Subramanian Swamy
139.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy has alleged that the PM Narendra Modi-led Centre has "surrendered to China's threats". "The two Babus turned Cabinet level advisors to [PM] Modi make India swallow all humiliation. Even Galwan Hill has been gifted as was Kailash Hill," Swamy tweeted. "Depsang had been lost earlier...[But PM] Modi will not name China," he added.

140.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
140.article_body: Heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely over Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh and Rajasthan between August 20-22. Rainfall is likely over Jharkhand, Odisha on August 20, Maharashtra on August 21-22 and Gujarat on August 23. West Bengal, Goa, J&K, Uttarakhand, UP, Punjab, Haryana, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Kerala are also likely to receive rainfall.

141.title: Roger Federer has inspired me in many ways: Novak Djokovic
141.article_body: Praising Roger Federer, world number six Novak Djokovic said the 20-time Grand Slam champion has inspired him in many ways. "Roger has particularly showed, not just me but all the generations after him, how efficiently and smartly you can train...in order to be a champion...how to...carry yourself on the court with dignity and everything," he added.

142.title: BJP alarmed by Kejriwal's popularity: AAP leader on CBI raid on Sisodia
142.article_body: Punjab Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) spokesperson Malvinder Singh Kang on Saturday alleged that the growing popularity of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal had alarmed the BJP, causing it to "misuse" the CBI. Kang was commenting on CBI's raid at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence. The 2024 general election is clearly a battle between PM Narendra Modi and Kejriwal, Kang said.

143.title: Monkeypox virus can stay on common household items for days: Study
143.article_body: A study by the US's Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has found that monkeypox virus can stay on many common household objects for several days. Researchers said around 70% of household items like couches, blankets, a coffee machine, computer mouse and light switches were found infected with the virus even after disinfection. None of them, however, were alive.

144.title: Employee shot dead outside sub-divisional court in Bihar's Motihari
144.article_body: A 45-year-old employee of a sub-divisional court was shot dead at its entry point by two bike-borne assailants in Bihar's Motihari on Saturday, a police officer said. The victim, Sanjay Thakur, was entering Areraj sub-divisional court premises around 10.30 am when the incident took place, the sub-divisional police officer said. Four empty cartridges were recovered from the spot, he added.

145.title: Hard for SA, Aus to not make it: Watson predicts WTC finalists for 2021-23
145.article_body: Predicting World Test Championship (WTC) finalists for the cycle 2021-23, ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said, "It's going to be hard for South Africa and Australia to not make it. They're both playing really good cricket." He added, "You can never discount India and Pakistan because they've got so many match winners outside of their home countries as well."

146.title: Don't want to be known as Alia Bhatt's doppelganger: Celesti Bairagey
146.article_body: Celesti Bairagey, who made her acting debut in show 'Udti Ka Naam Rajjo', has said she doesn't want to be known as Alia Bhatt's doppelganger. "People say...I resemble her, and I feel happy because...in a way, I'm being called cute. The problem arises when it starts becoming your identity...I'd never be happy if 'lookalike' tag becomes my identity," she added.

147.title: People from Pakistan always welcome me with a lot of love: Boman Irani
147.article_body: Actor Boman Irani in an interview said that cinema unites people, adding, "I don't know anything that unites people as much and that's why Bollywood is popular across Pakistan." "Whenever I've met people from Pakistan, be it in any part of...world, they always welcome me with a lot of love which brings a smile to my face," he added.

148.title: 12 injured in Russian missile strike near nuclear plant: Ukraine
148.article_body: A Russian missile hit a residential area of a southern Ukrainian town, Voznesensk, not far from the Pivdennoukrainsk Nuclear Power Plant on Saturday, Ukrainian officials informed. According to officials, 12 civilians, including four children, were wounded in the strike. "It is possible that this missile was aimed specifically at the Pivdennoukrainsk Nuclear Power Plant," Ukraine's Energoatom said.

149.title: Sonam Kapoor poses for Vogue cover during her pregnancy, pic goes viral
149.article_body: Sonam Kapoor, who welcomed a baby boy on Saturday, has featured on Vogue's cover. The cover, shot during Sonam's pregnancy, shows her with her baby bump. "Priorities do change and I think that the child will become mine. The truth...is...they didn't choose to come into this world. You decided to bring them here, so it's a...selfish decision," she told Vogue.

150.title: Would like Chahar, Bhuvneshwar to play together in T20Is: Sodhi
150.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Singh Sodhi has said that he would "like to see" seamers Deepak Chahar and Bhuvneshwar Kumar playing "together" in T20Is "if conditions suit them". "In T20Is, you can be a genuine wicket-taker if you have the ability to move the ball both ways and...[Chahar along with Bhuvneshwar] can make...early dents into the opposition's batting order," Sodhi added.

151.title: Earth narrowly escapes collision with 420-foot-wide asteroid: NASA
151.article_body: A 420-foot-wide asteroid 2019 AV13, which was approaching Earth, has flown past the planet, missing it narrowly on Saturday, NASA said. The giant asteroid came 5.2 million km close to the Earth but didn't deviate towards it. Had it struck the planet, the asteroid would've caused huge disaster, flattening a radius of a few kilometres accompanied by earthquakes and tsunamis.

152.title: Chandigarh airport to be named after Shaheed Bhagat Singh: Punjab CM
152.article_body: The state governments of Punjab and Haryana have agreed to rename Chandigarh International Airport after freedom fighter Shaheed Bhagat Singh, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said on Saturday. "Had a meeting with Haryana Deputy Chief Minister Dushyant Chautala on this issue today," Mann added.

153.title: 30,225 animals in Haryana infected with lumpy skin disease; 211 dead
153.article_body: At least 30,225 animals in eight districts of Haryana have been infected with the lumpy skin disease. Haryana Chief Secretary Sanjeev Kaushal on Saturday gave directions to the officials concerned to ensure 100% vaccination of cattle within the next seven days across the state. Of the 30,225 infected animals, 211 have died and 16,939 have recovered, a government spokesperson said.

154.title: In pics: From Jupiter to Earth, images taken by NASA's Voyager spacecraft
154.article_body: After 45 years of service, NASA is planning to shut down the Voyager spacecraft. During their course, the two Voyager spacecraft have travelled farther than any man-made object. It has captured amazing photos of several celestial bodies, including Saturn and its three moons, Jupiter's Great Red Spot, Earth and the moon, Uranus and Jupiter's second largest moon Callisto, among others.

155.title: Maha ATS files case against unknown persons in AK-47-boat case
155.article_body: Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) has registered a case under the Arms Act against unknown persons, in connection to the boat that was found with AK-47 rifles off Raigad coast on August 18. The Navi Mumbai unit of ATS is investigating the case, an official said. The yacht with rifles and ammunition was found off the coast by local fisherfolk.

156.title: BJP sole party that works to make country, not government: Rajnath Singh
156.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said BJP is the "sole party that does not function to make the government but to make the country". He was inaugurating the party's new 'Panchkamal' office in Haryana's Panchkula. Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar, also present at the event, said the building was not just "a party office but a temple".

157.title: Death toll from fire tragedy at Thai nightclub rises to 20
157.article_body: The death toll due to a fire that broke out at a nightclub in Thailand's Chonburi province on August 5 has risen to 20, Thai health officials said. Authorities had recovered 13 charred bodies from the site of the tragedy. As many as 25 injured are still receiving treatment, with nine of them on ventilators, the local health authority said.

158.title: Chahar is a bit lower in the pecking order in T20Is: Saba Karim
158.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim said that he feels that seamer Deepak Chahar is a "bit lower" in the pecking order in T20Is even when "fully fit". "You have...Jasprit Bumrah and the experience of Bhuvneshwar Kumar and also youngsters like Avesh Khan and Arshdeep Singh. Chahar has improved...but he has been expensive at the death," Karim said.

159.title: Kejriwal, Sisodia to travel to Gujarat next week for poll campaign
159.article_body: Amidst the CBI case against Delhi's excise policy irregularities, CM Arvind Kejriwal said he and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia will visit Gujarat next week. Kejriwal said they will travel with the message that if voted to power, Gujarat will get free and quality education as well as healthcare services. Assembly elections in Gujarat are due in the next few months.

160.title: TMC leader stabbed to death in West Bengal; 4 detained
160.article_body: A Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader named Alam was stabbed to death in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district on Saturday morning. Police said they have detained four people in connection with the murder. As per Times Now, Alam was allegedly shot at before being stabbed multiple times in Basanti town. The motive for the attack is yet to be ascertained.

161.title: 2 women electrocuted while cutting grass in a field in UP's Etah
161.article_body: Two women were electrocuted to death while cutting grass in a field in Chhitauni village in UP's Etah district. The deceased, Chandravati (55) and Usha Devi (60), died when a high-tension wire broke and fell on them, police said. Notably, the villagers demanded that the district administration and the electricity department provide financial aid to the families of the deceased.

162.title: Terror threat received by Mumbai Police should be taken seriously: Ajit Pawar
162.article_body: After Mumbai Police's traffic wing received several text messages on its helpline number threatening a "26/11-like" attack, NCP leader Ajit Pawar on Saturday said these threats should be taken seriously. "The state government should take this threat seriously and our police are very able in such situations," Pawar said. "But central agencies should also look into the matter," Pawar added.

163.title: We named her 'Antim' so we don't get another daughter: U-20 world champ wrestler's mother
163.article_body: Krishna Kumari, the mother of Antim Panghal who became the first-ever Indian woman to bag gold at Under-20 Wrestling World Championships, revealed how they named her daughter. She said, "We named our daughter Antim so...we don’t get another daughter as we got four daughters." "Antim has become Pehli (first) in the wrestling world today," she added about her win.

164.title: Wrestler Antim creates history, becomes 1st Indian woman to win gold at U-20 World C'ships
164.article_body: Wrestler Antim Panghal has created history by becoming the first Indian woman to win a gold medal at the Under-20 Wrestling World Championships. The 17-year-old defeated Kazakhstan's Altyn Shagayeva 8-0 in the final of the 53-kg category to achieve the feat. Antim had also won gold medal at the Asian Junior Championships earlier this year.

165.title: 13 potential regions for landing the next humans on Moon identified by NASA
165.article_body: NASA announced 13 potential landing sites for its upcoming Artemis III mission to return humans to the Moon for first time since Apollo. Each of these regions is located within six degrees of latitude of lunar South Pole. The regions contain sites that provide continuous access to sunlight throughout a 6.5-day period- the planned duration of Artemis III surface mission.

166.title: Extremely painful: Himachal CM over heavy losses due to torrential rains
166.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Saturday expressed concerns over heavy losses to lives and properties as torrential rains battered the state. "The incidents of untimely death of some people due to heavy rains across the state are extremely painful," Thakur said. He directed the district administrations to ensure relief, rescue and rehabilitation works in the affected areas.

167.title: No new cars, greet everyone with namaste, adab: Bihar Dy CM to ministers
167.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav has issued a series of dos and don'ts to the newly-elected ministerial colleagues of Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD). "Ministers...will not buy any new cars for themselves in the department," his order stated. Yadav also requested the ministers to be courteous towards everyone and promote the tradition of salutation with 'namaste' and 'adab'.

168.title: Zimbabwe bowler's relative asks Chahar 'Can I touch you?' before taking pic, video viral
168.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a relative of a Zimbabwe cricketer asking India cricketer Deepak Chahar, "Can I touch you?" before taking a picture with him. In the video, the woman can be seen laughing once Chahar agrees. "He is very humble...I liked it how accommodating he is," the woman later said.

169.title: I have done this on my own: Kartik on completing 11 years in B'wood
169.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, speaking about completing 11 years in the film industry, said, "I take pride in the fact that I've done this on my own and with...help of people who put their trust in my capabilities without knowing me." "They went for the craft instead of lineage," he added. Kartik will next be seen in films like 'Freddy' and 'Shehzada'.

170.title: Let's turn this sh*t back: Kyrgios on his arrival in New York ahead of US Open
170.article_body: Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios took to Instagram Stories to share a picture of himself on his arrival in New York ahead of US Open 2022 and wrote, "Young Kygs (Kyrgios) in NY (New York). Let's turn this sh*t back." The 27-year-old Australian has never reached beyond the third round of the US Open in eight attempts so far.

171.title: Rajasthan BJP takes out protest march over deteriorating law & order
171.article_body: The BJP took out a protest march in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Saturday against the state government over its failure to maintain law and order. "The law and order situation in Rajasthan has completely deteriorated to which CM Ashok Gehlot has no answer," Rajasthan BJP chief Satish Poonia said. Under his rule, Rajasthan has become a capital of crime, Poonia added.

172.title: RPF rescues 67 live turtles from train in Bihar's Kishanganj
172.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) on Saturday rescued 67 live turtles from seven unclaimed bags in a coach of Ajmer-Kishanganj Garib Nawaz Express at Bihar's Kishanganj station. "No arrests have been made so far. RPF has informed officials of the district forest department about the recovery of these turtles," RPF Inspector said. Authorities suspect the turtles were poached from Ajmer.

173.title: Train hits 3 walking with earphones in separate incidents in UP; all dead
173.article_body: Three people, walking on railway tracks with their earphones plugged in, died after being hit by different trains in Uttar Pradesh.
