It's been ages since I've seen him...A lovely person to work with, lovely co-star, very understanding. Though I was very new then...he was really nice to me," she added.

347.title: I know it was pretty basic: Zuckerberg after being mocked over metaverse selfie
347.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has responded after he was mocked for posting a low-resolution selfie of his metaverse avatar. Sharing another picture on Instagram, Zuckerberg said, "I know the photo I posted earlier...was pretty basic -- it was taken very quickly to celebrate a launch." He announced that there will be "major updates" to Meta's VR platform, Horizon Worlds, soon.

348.title: Hawala agent with terror links operating as Delhi trader arrested
348.article_body: An alleged Hawala operator was arrested from Jammu bus stand by Delhi Police and Jammu & Kashmir Police with the help of central agencies, officials said on Friday. The accused identified as Mohammad Yasin allegedly contributed to funding of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and Al-Badr terror groups. Yasin was reportedly operating under the guise of a garment trader from Delhi's Meena Bazar.

349.title: Delhi logs 1,417 fresh COVID-19 cases, 3 deaths
349.article_body: Delhi reported 1,417 new cases of COVID-19 on Friday and three deaths due to the infection, according to data shared by the health department. Delhi's COVID-19 death toll reached 26,411 with the fresh fatalities. The city witnessed a decline in its test positivity rate as a rate of 7.53% was registered on Friday against Thursday's 9.42%.

350.title: He has fantastic temperament: Ferguson as character witness for Giggs
350.article_body: Ex-Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson was called in as a character witness for his ex-player Ryan Giggs' trial. Ferguson told the court that Giggs had "fantastic temperament", adding that Giggs fulfilled everything they wished for and never lost his temper in front of him. Giggs is on trial on charges of assault and use of coercive behaviour against an ex-girlfriend.

351.title: Rice mill owned by Mondal's daughter raided, ₹30-lakh car found: Report
351.article_body: The CBI on Friday raided a rice mill owned by arrested TMC leader Anubrata Mondal's daughter, Sukanya, in West Bengal's Bolpur. "Five cars were parked inside the rice mill premises. A Ford Endeavour [worth around] ₹30 lakh was also found...This car...was often used by Mondal when he used to come to Kolkata from Bolpur," a report said quoting CBI officials.

352.title: CBI raids won't scare Manish Sisodia or AAP: Akhilesh Yadav
352.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said CBI raids on Manish Sisodia will not scare the Delhi Deputy CM or the AAP. "The BJP is frightened that the AAP is going to upset their plans in Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat," added Yadav. He said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar breaking his alliance with the BJP was a good message to the opposition.

353.title: Railways to launch Mathura-Vrindavan intercity rail bus soon
353.article_body: On the occasion of the Janmashtami festival, the Indian Railways has announced that an intercity rail bus from Mathura to Vrindavan will be launched soon. The rail bus' capacity will be 50 passengers. The Ministry of Railways shared pictures of the rail bus on Twitter. Vrindavan is connected to Mathura by a 12 km long meter gauge rail track.

354.title: Girl run over by truck while trying to escape kidnappers in Bihar
354.article_body: A teenage girl in Bihar died after being run over by a truck while she was reportedly escaping her abductors. Two men allegedly abducted the girl on their motorcycle and she managed to fling herself off the running vehicle but was crushed under the truck behind them. Locals beat up the truck driver while the alleged abductors managed to escape.

355.title: 2 hybrid terrorists with arms & ammunition arrested in Kupwara
355.article_body: Two suspected hybrid terrorists were arrested by security forces in J&K's Kupwara district, police said on Friday. The duo was arrested following a lead received during the investigation of a case in which three hybrid terrorists were arrested in Handwara on August 4, police added. Two pistols and 58 pistol rounds were recovered from the duo's possession, police informed.

356.title: Still believe I belong: Daniel Ricciardo on F1 future rumours
356.article_body: Amid rumours about his future at McLaren and F1, Daniel Ricciardo said he "still thrives off" the sport and believes he "belongs". "I could probably keep going, but there are a few things...I still believe I belong and can do it," said Ricciardo. Reports said the team is looking to replace Ricciardo with F2 champion Oscar Piastri next year.

357.title: Brilliant effort from team: Elgar on SA winning 1st Test vs England on Day 3
357.article_body: After South Africa won the first Test against England by an innings and 12 runs, South Africa captain Dean Elgar said it was a brilliant effort from the team and they didn't expect the game to finish so quickly. South Africa won the match on third day. Kagiso Rabada was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 5/52 and 2/27.

358.title: I would love ODIs to continue, have some meaning: Scott Styris
358.article_body: Former New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris said that he would love the ODI format to continue and have some meaning apart from only being featured at the Cricket World Cup. "I felt ODI was a mixture of power...Power, speed...all of that kicks in as well as the traditional cricket where there is the rotation of the strike," Styris said.

359.title: Wish for peaceful relations with India based on equity: Pak PM
359.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said he wishes for peaceful relations with India on the basis of "equity, justice and mutual respect", local media reported on Friday. "The international community has to play a facilitative role...as it was essential for...stability in South Asia," he said. Sharif made the comments during a meeting with the new Australian High Comm­issioner to Pakistan.

360.title: Wasim Jaffer trolls 'Bazball' after South Africa defeat England by an innings and 12 runs
360.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer trolled England over 'Bazball' after South Africa defeated them by an innings and 12 runs in the Lord's Test. Jaffer wrote, "'Bazball has done wonders in the fourth innings'...South Africa: There will be no fourth innings." England were bowled out for 165 in the first innings and 149 in the second innings.

361.title: I have been in favour of IPL's expansion for the past 10 years: Styris
361.article_body: After IPL got an extended window in the recently released 2023-27 Future Tours Program (FTP) cycle, former New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris said that he has been in "favour" of it. "I was in favour of it 10 years ago...I'm in favour of it now...We are starting to get there [3-month IPL season] now," Styris said.

362.title: Broke a very tough Dahi Handi 1.5 months back: Maha CM Shinde
362.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde said he and his supporters "broke a very tough Dahi Handi one-and-a-half months back". "It was very difficult, high, and we had to put up 50 strong layers but we succeeded," said the CM. He was alluding to the rebellion he led against the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena and its alliance with NCP and Congress.

363.title: TN inspector held for alleged role in bank heist; 3.7-kg gold seized
363.article_body: A police inspector was arrested for his alleged role in helping the perpetrators who robbed FedBank in Tamil Nadu's Chennai, police said on Friday. Additional Commissioner of Police TS Anbu said, "Robbery accused Santosh, brother-in-law of [inspector] Amalraj, kept gold [at] Amalraj's residence. Amalraj knew this but didn't inform the police." Police seized 3.7 kg of gold from Amalraj's residence.

364.title: 31 locations across India raided in Delhi excise policy case: CBI
364.article_body: CBI said that it is conducting raids at 31 locations across India including Delhi, Mumbai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and Bengaluru in the Delhi excise policy case. "Searches are being conducted...have led to the recovery of incriminating documents/articles, digital records, etc," said the CBI. The agency is probing a corruption case filed against the introduction of the new Delhi liquor policy.

365.title: Haryana SI sexually harasses physically challenged woman, arrested
365.article_body: A Sub-Inspector (SI) in Haryana's Nuh district has been arrested for allegedly demanding sexual favours from a physically-challenged woman. The SI contacted the woman following an FIR she had registered against her in-laws at Firozpur Jhirka Police Station. The woman alleged the accused demanded sexual favours and threatened to harm her case if his demands were not met.

366.title: Chhattisgarh govt inviting bids to lease out 24 tourism properties
366.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government is inviting bids from "experienced private investors" to lease out 24 state-owned motels and resorts for 30 years. The bids are open till September 5 for 14 non-functional and 10 functional properties under the Chhattisgarh Tourism Board. The initiative is expected to provide facilities to local and foreign tourists and raise employment opportunities, officials said.

367.title: Palestinian shot dead by Israeli forces during raid in West Bank
367.article_body: A 58-year-old man was shot dead by Israeli forces during an arrest raid in the West Bank on Friday, according to the deceased's brother. The raid was aimed at arresting Palestinians suspected of taking part in or planning attacks, the Israeli military said. The military said that its troops shot back after Palestinians opened fire and hurled firebombs at them.

368.title: Looking forward to making India proud again: CWG 2022 gold medallist Sreeja
368.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sreeja Akula, who won a gold medal along with her partner Sharath Kamal in mixed doubles event at the recently concluded Commonwealth Games 2022, said she is looking forward to making her nation proud again. Sreeja and Sharath became the first Indian pair to win gold in mixed doubles in the history of the Commonwealth Games.

369.title: Prefer to play Man Utd after they win 5-0: Liverpool coach Klopp
369.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said he would prefer to play against Manchester United if the Red Devils had won their last match 5-0. Klopp said he was wary of a strong comeback from United who had lost their previous match against Brentford 0-4. Liverpool themselves are yet to win their first match of the season after playing two back-to-back draws.

370.title: BJP chief JP Nadda to visit poll-bound Himachal Pradesh
370.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda is set to visit the poll-bound state of Himachal Pradesh and attend various events in Sirmaur on Saturday. He is expected to hold meetings with the leaders of the state unit to deliberate on the strategy for the upcoming Assembly elections. The BJP chief will also be addressing a public meeting in Paonta Sahib.

371.title: Officials give tennis player Bouchard credential with swimsuit pic, change it later
371.article_body: The officials at Odlum Brown VanOpen tournament gave Canadian tennis player Eugenie Bouchard credential with a swimsuit picture of the player. Bouchard took to Instagram Stories to share a picture of the credential, writing, "Can someone from @vanopentennis credential office explain pls??" Hours later, she shared another picture of the credential with her headshot and wrote, "Got a real one."

372.title: Captain Zoya becomes 1st Indian female pilot to be added to US Aviation Museum
372.article_body: Air India's Captain Zoya Agarwal has become the first Indian female pilot to be added to SFO Aviation Museum in the US. She was the first Indian woman pilot to fly an aircraft above the North pole covering a record-breaking distance of around 16,000 km. "I was amazed to see that I’m the only living object over there," said Agarwal

373.title: Sleeping pods for passengers inaugurated at Chennai airport, pics surface
373.article_body: A 'sleeping pod facility', with four bed-sized capsules, was inaugurated at Chennai airport. The 'Sleepzo' facility is located in the arrivals section of domestic terminal, near baggage belt number 1. "The facility can be availed on...hourly basis and has amenities like reading lights, charging stations, USB charger, luggage space, ambient lights, blower control," said Airports Authority of India.

374.title: Which 4 cricketers have taken 100 or more wickets on a single ground?
374.article_body: England's Stuart Broad has become the fourth cricketer after Muttiah Muralitharan, James Anderson and Rangana Herath to take 100 wickets on a single ground. With his three wickets in the Test against South Africa, the 36-year-old took his Test wicket tally at Lord's to 102. Muralitharan is the only cricketer to take 100-plus Test wickets at three separate stadiums each.

375.title: 'India, China must work together for Asian century,' says Jaishankar; China reacts
375.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar recently quoted Chinese leader Deng Xiaoping's remarks on India and China, saying, "The Asian century will be difficult to happen if India and China don't come together." Chinese Foreign Ministry backed his remarks, saying China and India have "far more common interests than differences". Jaishankar also said Indo-China relations were in a "difficult phase".

376.title: Islamic State cell member sentenced to life in prison in US for beheadings
376.article_body: A member of an Islamic State cell found guilty in April for his role in hostage-taking plot that led to beheadings of American journalists and aid workers was sentenced to life in prison by a US court. El Shafee Elsheikh was sentenced in Virginia. The ex-British citizen was found guilty of charges including lethal hostage-taking and conspiracy to commit murder.

377.title: Revenue of Indian Railways increased after I played Geet, jokes Kareena
377.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor, during her appearance in the courtroom comedy 'Case Toh Banta Hai', joked that the revenue of Indian Railways increased after the release of her film 'Jab We Met'. "After I played Geet, the sale of harem pants and revenues of Indian Railways both have increased by the way," she said. 'Jab We Met' was released in 2007.

378.title: Fishing trawler capsizes in Bay of Bengal, 5 missing
378.article_body: Five people went missing after a fishing trawler capsized in the Bay of Bengal on Friday, an official of a fishermen's association said. The boat, which had 18 people onboard, capsized near the Kendo island of West Bengal, which marks the end of Sundarbans territory. The 13 rescued fishermen were taken to a hospital in Kakdwip.

379.title: Don't step out: Odisha CM's appeal to 4 districts amid heavy rainfall warning
379.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik appealed to people of four districts including Balasore, Keonjhar, Mayurbhanj and Bhadrak not to venture out of their homes on Saturday amid heavy rainfall forecast. "I appeal to people not to panic but rather follow the instructions of the administration," Patnaik said. The IMD has issued red alert in the four districts for Saturday morning.

380.title: N'Golo Kante out injured for few weeks: Chelsea manager Tuchel
380.article_body: Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said midfielder N'Golo Kante will be sidelined for a few weeks after picking up a hamstring injury during their match against Tottenham Hotspur. "We're talking weeks, which is not good news. We're disappointed and sad," said Tuchel. He added that striker Armando Broja and midfielder Mateo Kovacic are also injured for their next match against Leeds.

381.title: Such incidents keep happening: SBSP chief after girl stripped in UP
381.article_body: SBSP chief OP Rajbhar drew criticism for saying "such incidents keep happening" after a video of a girl being stripped by six men went viral. "The population of UP is 25 crore...there's not enough police to guard every house," he said. The girl and her male friend were reportedly thrashed while they were sitting together in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur.

382.title: Next state budget to be dedicated to youth, students: Raj CM Gehlot
382.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday said the state's next budget will be dedicated to the youth, students and over one crore women will be given smartphones. The Gehlot government will be presenting its last budget in 2023. He appealed to the youth and students to give suggestions and said their views will be included in the budget announcements.

383.title: BSF head constable killed in attack by insurgents in Tripura
383.article_body: A Border Security Force (BSF) head constable, Girjesh Kumar Uddey, was killed in Tripura on Friday after indiscriminate firing by suspected insurgents, officials said. It is believed that some shots were also fired from across the Bangladesh border, officials added. "Uddey was immediately evacuated by helicopter to Agartala, where he later succumbed to the grievous injuries," BSF officials said.

384.title: Madhavan visits India's 1st indigenous aircraft carrier Vikrant, shares pics
384.article_body: Actor R Madhavan took to Instagram to share some pictures from his visit to India's first indigenous aircraft carrier Vikrant. "My utmost gratitude and thank you for this very special honour. Such a privilege to be invited by the #indiannavy on the indigenously built aircraft carrier soon to be commissioned," he wrote. Recently, actor Mohanlal also visited IAC Vikrant.

385.title: Salute to Dhawan, Pujara for their drive and passion: Kaif
385.article_body: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has spoken about Indian batters Shikhar Dhawan and Cheteshwar Pujara. "A salute to Dhawan and Pujara for their drive and passion," Kaif said. The former India U-19 World Cup winning captain added, "No negativity, no complaint, if I have a bat in hand I will score, that's pure love for the game."

386.title: India has been incredibly kind to me: AB de Villiers
386.article_body: After collaborating with an Indian NGO to guide underprivileged children, former South Africa skipper AB de Villiers said that "India has been incredibly kind" to him over the years. "I am always looking for ways to give something back [to India]. I am happy to be associated with MAD (Make A Difference)...Their work is incredible," De Villiers said.

387.title: She's studying overseas: Ajay on daughter's rumoured acting debut
387.article_body: Amid rumours about Nysa Devgn making her Bollywood debut, Ajay Devgn said that his 19-year-old daughter hasn't made up her mind yet. "She's just a teenager. She hasn't told [us] what her...career choice would be. As of now, she's studying overseas," he added. "If she decides to pursue a career in the film industry, it'll be her choice," said Ajay.

388.title: Aaliyah got anxiety after rape threats, I dropped everything & ran to US: Anurag
388.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap revealed that his daughter Aaliyah Kashyap started suffering from anxiety after getting threats on social media. Aaliyah also got rape threats after she posted pictures in lingerie. Anurag recalled that he dropped everything and ran to the US to be with his daughter. "She really is out there expressing herself but her anxiety bothers me," said Anurag.

389.title: Top win: Ian Bishop on SA's an innings and 12-run win vs England in 1st Test
389.article_body: Following South Africa's an innings and 12-run win against England in first Test at Lord's, Ian Bishop took to Twitter and wrote, "Top win for South Africa." Mohammad Kaif tweeted, "South Africa shows that Bazball doesn't work against a world class bowling attack with variety and a sharp captain who sets smart fields." South Africa lead the three-match series 1-0.

390.title: Lalu's son-in-law running govt: BJP MP on his pics at Bihar govt meetings
390.article_body: Pictures showing RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav's son-in-law, Shailesh Kumar, at Bihar government's official meetings have emerged on social media. Reacting to this, BJP Rajya Sabha MP Sushil Kumar Modi said Lalu's son-in-law and party workers are running the government and Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar is "helpless". Modi said Shailesh had no business being present at the meetings.

391.title: Army defuses unexploded ordnance shell in J&K's Samba district
391.article_body: An unexploded ordnance was detected and defused by Indian Army on Friday in Jammu & Kashmir's Samba district, officials said. Personnel of the Tiger division assisted civilian administration in safely extricating the live ordnance shell from a heavily populated area, officials added. According to officials, the shell was found near Kikri Morh in Balole Nala of Samba.

392.title: Jharkhand CM lays foundation stone for 3 projects worth ₹666 cr in Ranchi
392.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren laid foundation stones for three road projects worth around ₹666 crore in Ranchi on Friday. "The state government has been working to strengthen road infrastructure and make it convenient for common people," Soren said. The road construction department claimed the state will witness road network projects worth ₹35,000 to ₹40,000 crore in two to three years.

393.title: Speculation of joining Cong is fake news: Shivpal Yadav
393.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia President Shivpal Singh Yadav has termed the speculations of him joining the Congress party as "fake news". The Uttar Pradesh MLA said that he is trying to unite the Opposition for the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "When we were not considered as an alliance partner, we parted ways," Shivpal said about his party's alliance with SP.

394.title: New York Times denies BJP's claims that its Delhi schools report is 'paid news'
394.article_body: The New York Times (NYT) has responded after BJP called the US newspaper's report on Delhi schools and education system a "paid promotion". "Our report about Delhi's education system is based on impartial, on-ground reporting," said the NYT, adding, "[Our] journalism...is independent, free from political or advertiser influence." Delhi CM had earlier held a press conference over the report.

395.title: Scientists develop new simple method to destroy 'forever chemicals'
395.article_body: Scientists have developed a new method to destroy 'forever chemicals', using relatively low temperatures and common reagents, that capitalises on the 'Achilles' heel' of PFAS. They heated these chemicals in the solvent dimethyl sulfoxide and found that it "decapitated" a section of the molecule and left behind the "safest form of fluorine". PFAS causes cancer and other diseases in humans.

396.title: How does the latest World Test Championship points table read?
396.article_body: After defeating England by an innings and 12 runs at Lord's, South Africa have consolidated their position on the top of the World Test Championship points table. South Africa are placed first with 75% of points won, while England are seventh on the table with 31.37% of points won. India are placed fourth on the table, while Pakistan are fifth.

397.title: India Women announces squads for England tour, Jhulan returns for ODIs
397.article_body: India Women squads for the upcoming tour of England have been announced. Pacer Jhulan Goswami, who last played for India in March 2022, has been included in the ODI squad. Kiran Navgire, who plays for Nagaland, received her maiden call-up to India's T20I squad. India will play three T20Is beginning September 10, and three ODIs starting September 18.

398.title: Wildfire in eastern Spain is out of control: Authorities
398.article_body: Authorities in eastern Spain on Friday said a wildfire is out of control and 35 aircraft are fighting the blaze which has entered its fifth day. The fire has already scorched 19,000 hectares of forest land. Despite a bout of rainfall on Thursday, strong winds made the fire "very aggressive", the Valencia regional government said.

399.title: Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla's term extended till Aug 22, 2023
399.article_body: The central government on Friday extended for the third time the service tenure of Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla for another year, up to August 22, 2023, according to a Personnel Ministry order. Bhalla, a 1984-batch Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer of the Assam-Meghalaya cadre, assumed the office on August 23, 2019.

400.title: Kerala is not Russia under Stalin: Cong's Satheesan to CM Vijayan
400.article_body: Kerala's Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan has criticised the state police's move to banish Farzeen Majeed, a Youth Congress worker, from Kannur district under the Kerala Anti-social Activities (Prevention) Act. "CM Pinarayi Vijayan should bear in mind that this is not Russia under Stalin...Of the 19 cases against [Majeed]...12 are related to...violating the Covid-19 protocol," he said.

401.title: WHO recommends 2 monoclonal antibody treatments for Ebola
401.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has recommended two existing treatments for the Ebola virus, saying they significantly reduce the number of deaths. The WHO said monoclonal antibodies Ebanga (mAb114) and Inmazeb (REGN-EB3) have "revolutionised" the treatment for the disease. The treatments are appropriate for pregnant and breastfeeding persons, old people, children and newborns, the WHO said.

402.title: H'yana appoints retired HC judge to probe killing of DSP in Nuh
402.article_body: The Haryana government on Thursday appointed a single-member inquiry commission to investigate the killing of DSP Surender Singh who was allegedly mowed down by a dumper truck during a raid against illegal mining in Nuh. The commission consists of retired Punjab and Haryana HC judge LN Mittal. The commission has been asked to submit its report within a month.

403.title: No reward bigger than this: Kartik as street vendor praises 'Bhool...'
403.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram to share a video showing him interacting with a young street vendor. In the video, the boy could be seen telling Kartik how much he loved 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. He also did the signature step of the film before asking the actor for a selfie. "No reward bigger than this," Kartik captioned the video.
